options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>.</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> .

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>.</mo></math>

solution.text: Water potential is the difference in the free energy or chemical potential per unit molar volume of water in a system and that of pure water at the same temperature and pressure. Water potential is represented by Greek letter  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi></math>  (psi) or  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi></math>  . Water potential is the sum total of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>  and  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></math>  . Therefore,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></math>
